items.sentence: Tom sat across from Mary, his ex-girlfriend.
Do you really want to run your own business?
Do you think Tom is becoming more like Mary?
Why doesn\'t this building have an elevator?
Why don\'t we try doing this again tomorrow?
Tom and Mary walked for a moment in silence.
Tom and Mary walked out, leaving John alone.
Tom and Mary want to know why John did that.
Tom and Mary were always traveling together.
I can\'t believe you\'re trying to bribe me.
I can\'t change who I am or what I\'ve done.
Tom has grown accustomed to Mary\'s nagging.
I don\'t think Tom will know how to do that.
It is regrettable that I can\'t go with you.
Tom says he\'s not interested in doing that.
Tom still doesn\'t know what he needs to do.
You didn\'t tell me you knew Tom\'s address.
Tom works at a restaurant not far from here.
Tom would like to become a sports announcer.
Have you brought me what you said you would?
